description: Reduces to randomised 0-1 loss. Correct predictions give zero loss, while incorrect predictions give one loss.
Choosing x_0 when the true outcome is x_1 is worse than picking any other outcome wrong
Choosing x_2 when the true outcome is x_1 is worse than picking any other outcome wrong
Choosing a wrong outcome when x_1 is the true outcome is worse than choosing a wrong outcome when x_1 is NOT the true outcome
Choosing x_1 when the true outcome is x_0 is worse than picking any other outcome wrong
Choosing x_1 when the true outcome is x_2 is worse than picking any other outcome wrong
Choosing x_1 when the true outcome is another outcome is worse than choosing a wrong outcome when x_1 IS the true outcome
Choosing x_0 when the true outcome is x_1, and vice versa is worse than picking any other wrong outcome when the true outcome is another outcome
Choosing x_2 when the true outcome is x_1, and vice versa is worse than picking any other wrong outcome when the true outcome is another outcome
Choosing x_1 when the true outcome is x_0, and choosing x_2 when the true outcome is x_1 is worse than picking any other wrong outcome when the true outcome is another outcome
Choosing x_0 when the true outcome is x_1, and choosing x_1 when the true outcome is x_2 is worse than picking any other wrong outcome when the true outcome is another outcome
Choosing x_0 when the true outcome is x_1 is better than choosing any other outcome wrong, for any true outcome
Choosing x_2 when the true outcome is x_1 is better than choosing any other outcome wrong, for any true outcome
Choosing x_1 when the true outcome is x_0 is better than choosing any other outcome wrong, for any true outcome
Choosing x_1 when the true outcome is x_2 is better than choosing any other outcome wrong, for any true outcome
